Articles.Content:
Hi,

Recently I have installed KSP and I put some of the top 100 mods ( loking for the ones compatible with 0.24.2).

I have KSP 0.24.2

The game is crashing when loading.

Please find attached the error logs.

Could please somebody help me?

Thanks

Error.log: http://pastebin.com/8S0wA0rm

Output.log:https://www.dropbox.com/s/zhyf23bq16wtnqu/output.txt?dl=0

Thanks for attaching logs! (And welcome to the forums!)

You ran out of memory.* Use fewer part mods and/or use Active Texture Management in aggressive mode (and if you already are, increase the scale= parameter).

*Note that the version of KSP you are using is 32bit, and therefore limited to approximately 3.3GB of memory at a time. However, the only stable 64bit version of KSP is for linux.

Hi,

Thanks for your promt reply!

I see in the log that I have 1GB of memory what is incorrect... I have 6GB!

On the other hand I executed KSP_64.exe not 32 one so I should be able to manage my 6GB right?'

THanks
Don't forget about how much your OS is using best guess is around 2 GB to 3 GB , So you don't have much to play with.

On the other hand I executed KSP_64.exe not 32 one so I should be able to manage my 6GB right?'

This bit of your log shows that you actually ran KSP.exe and it is also in a folder on your desktop which is known to cause issues...

7.C:\Users\Dany\Desktop\kerbal space program\ksp.exe, run by Dany.

I suggest moving your whole install to somewhere else, e.g. C:\Games and then try KSP.exe again. If the same thing happens then actually try KSP_64.exe, you might get lucky (though I suspect that the general stability issues of the 64 bit version will probably cause you issues anyway).

Don't forget about how much your OS is using best guess is around 2 GB to 3 GB , So you don't have much to play with.

If Windows is taking 2-3GB of ram by itself you have a really messed up installation.

Hi,

Thanks for your promt reply!

I see in the log that I have 1GB of memory what is incorrect... I have 6GB!

On the other hand I executed KSP_64.exe not 32 one so I should be able to manage my 6GB right?'

THanks

As I said in my post, Windows x64 KSP (which you did NOT run, as said above) is not stable.

Also, the 1GB mentioned in the log is for your video card.

i have problems with my game crashing i have 3 or 4 big mods like KW rocketry and B9. my computer can run the game with the mods that i know i have 8 GB of ram.

http://pastebin.com/cYceuFS0
